summary: brown algae, including Ecklonia species and Ishige okamurae, have been considerably evaluated as these species contains phlorotannins. phlorotannins with both phenyl and phenoxy units having different molecular weights are present in the marine brown algae. Eckol is a precursor compound illustrating the dibenzo-1,4-dioxin class of phlorotannins. it contains phloroglucinol components linked to each other in multiple fashions. it has been shown to exhibit antioxidant [13,21,22], anti-inflammatory [23,24], anti-obesity [27], anti-hypertensive [28], and antibacterial and antiviral [29] activity. cellular reactive oxygen species (ROS) determination using Dichloro-dihydro-fluorescein diacetate (DCFH-DA) measure of cellular glutathione (GSH) level. Significantly reduced ROS level at 50 M concentration. moderate inhibitory activity against membrane protein oxidation. decreased H2O2-induced mitochondrial ROS levels and attenuated mitochondrial Ca2+ levels. induction of MnSOD following activation of AMP-activated protein kinase/forkhead box. in vitro, anti-diabetic Protein tyrosine phosphatase (PTP1B) and -glucosidase inhibitory assay. inhibited AGEs formation, -amylase, rat lens aldose reductase activity. Western immunoblot, confocal microscopic analysis. Diminished expression of Fas-mediated cell-death proteins (tBid, caspase-3, and poly (ADP-ribose) polymerase) ethanol induced damage in Chang liver cells In vitro [50] Cholinesterase enzyme inhibition assay. Exhibited good inhibition in MAOs-A and-B enzyme activity. Protected PC12 cells against A-induced cytotoxicity. in vitro [58] Real-time RT-PCR analysis, Western blot analysis, prostaglandin (PG) E2 enzyme immunoassay, immunohistochemical detection of proliferating nuclear cell antigen. Suppressed expression of cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) leading to decrease in COX-2 protein production in UVB-induced skin carcinogenesis. osin and an in situ DNA end- labeling technique. protection against apoptosis induced by radiation in mice jejunal crypts. ant influenza virus neuraminidase inhibition assay. in vitro, in vivo, in vivo and in vivo. expressions of cell adhesion molecule (CAM) (VCAM-1, ICAM-1 and E-selectin) inhibited binding of monocytes to HMGB1-stimulated endothelial cells and inhibited trans-endothelial migration (TEM). cell stimulation, anti-degranulation assay and qRT-PCR Inhibited the expression and production of proinflammatory mediators and cytokines in haCat cells. immunoglobulin E (IgE) and anti-IgE antibodies inhibit degranulation of KU812 cells. in vitro assay of hyaluronidase, shown inhibition in hyaluronidase activity. in vitro, anticoagulation assay and thrombin activity assay. prolonged activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) and prothrombin time (PT) significantly and inhibited the generation of thrombin or FXa in human umbilical vein endothelial cells. reduced the level of TG, total cholesterol (TC) and low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol (LDL-C) and increased level of the high-density lipoprotein-cholesterol (HDLC) in vivo [80] Thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS) assay. manganese superoxide dismutase (MnSOD) is an antioxidant mitochondrial enzyme in exhibiting cytoprotective effects against oxidative stress. eckol at 10 g/mL recovered MnSOD expression and activity that had been decreased by 600 M hydrogen peroxide (H2O2). eckol mediated the eckol-induced activation of the HO-1 promoter. eckol has the ability to attenuate oxidative stress-induced cell death through Nrf2-mediated HO-1 activation via Erk and PI3K/Akt signaling. eckol showed a 79% radical scavenging effect on intracellular ROS. Eckol also prevented lipid peroxidation in a TBARS assay. eckol also increased the transcriptional activity of NF-B. phlorotannins of lower molecular weights (eckol and phlorofucofuroeckol A) were more potent as compared to higher weights (dieckol and 8,8 -bieckol) study evaluated E. cava extract on its antioxidant potential in airborne particulate matter (PM10) exposed cultured keratinocytes. chronic diabetic conditions include type 1 diabetes (T1DM) and type 2 diabetes (T2DM) the body does not produce enough insulin or fails to respond adequately to insulin, leading to high glucose concentrations in the blood. the occurrence of severe hypoglycemia is related to intensive insulin therapy. eckol showed an IC50 of 54.68 M, although most isolated phlorotannins showed no activity in the AGEs inhibition assay. the results were in contrast to another study in which the inhibitory effect of the isolated compounds on glycation, was 96.2% for eckol, 86.7% for dieckol, and 76.0% for aminoguanidine at 1 mM. eckol is a potential therapeutic agent for controlling postprandial blood glucose levels, thereby preventing diabetic complications. the ability to prevent hepatic damage is vitally important as it is involved in the detoxification of xenobiotics and drugs. phlorotannins dioxinodehydroeckol, eckol, phlorofucofuroeckol-A, dieckol, and triphlorethol A exhibited hepatoprotection with EC50 values of 3.4, 8.3, 4.4, 5.5, and 11.5 g/mL. eckol is suitable as potential therapeutics for the treatment of hepatotoxicity as compared to other dioxinodehydroeckol and phlorofucofuroeckol-A exhibiting EC50 values of 62.0 and 79.2 g/mL. other compounds, including eckol (EC50 > 100), exhibited no activity in HepG2 cells against the cytotoxic effects of tacrine [92]. phlorofucofuroeckol-A, dieckol, triphlorethol-A, 2-phloroeckol, eckol and dieckol isolated from methanolic extract of E. bicyclis exhibited IC50 values of 7.20 0.71 M and 83.44 1.48 M against hMAO-A and hMAO-B. eckol can be useful to manage PD and other neurological disorders through the inhibition of MAO. phlorotannins eckol, dioxinodehydroeckol, dieckol, and triphlorethol-A showed better binding at the receptor than triphlorethol-A and dieckol. the hypnotic effects of the ethanol extract and its EtOAc fraction were inhibited by flumazenil which is a specific GABAA–BZD receptor gamma-ray)-induced damage. 0.5 and 3.5 0.5 endogenous CFUs from the eckol plus irradiation group and irradiation control group. the results did not alter for the non-irradiated group when treated with observed 12 h after irradiation. the frequency of apoptotic fragments in crypt cells was reduced in the eckol-treated group by 16.63% compared to the untreated group (4.51 0.30%) eckol treatment modulated the immunohistochemical localization and magnitude of apoptosis-related proteins in jejunal crypt cells. eckol pre-treatment scavenged ROS in -irradiated V79-4 cells. photo aging is expression of certain members is induced by UV irradiation. ckol isolated from E. stolonifera diminished expression of MMP-1 induced by TNF- and basal expression of MMP-1. reduced both NF-B and AP-1 reporter gene activity in human dermal fibroblasts. excessive generation of ROS causing oxidative stress in the skin is due to the UVB radiation ultimately damaging DNA. a decrease in tumor incidence was seen when brown algal polyphenols were administered through diet (79%) and skin (94%) with moderate protection against skin carcinogenesis induced by UV-B radiation in mice. the propagation of tumor decreased from 8.54 0.75 to 4.73 0.74 (p 0.005) and 3.75 0.54 (p 0.001) when treated with 0.1% and 0.5% brown polyphenols through diet. eckol had about 21%, 43%, and 53% inhibitory activity at concentrations of 0.5, 5, and 50 M. temporary threshold shift accelerates the age-related hearing loss even if it is a transient one. the primary cause of TTS is ROS, the protective activity of polyphenolic extract of E. cava (PPEE) was evaluated. eckol containing PPEE may have good potential to break the vicious cycle of TTS. eckol has been evaluated copiously for a broad spectrum of activities to establish it as a potential therapeutic agent. the results of the cell-based experiments could act as future references for in vivo experiments to doubtlessly highlight antioxidant potential. eckol also showed promising results in diabetes suppression. neuroprotection, the GABAA–BZD receptor and dopamine receptors hold a good future for eckol due to its potent anticoagulative effect. the high activity of eckol in AChE enzyme inhibition but not in BChE inhibition [26] explains its selective nature, including moderate hMAO-B inhibition [53] cell-based and in vivo experiments are imperative to show its actual therpeutics. the antithrombotic activity of eckol was attributed to ACE-inhibition. the closed-ring dibenzo-1,4-dioxane was crucial for the inhibition. eckol could further be tested in vivo to establish its potential. the use of eckol as an anti-oxidant, anti-diabetic, radioprotective, hepatoprotective, and anti-inflammatory agent is a refreshing new discovery. the cell-based experiments related to tyrosinase inhibition by eckol could be beneficial as future references for experiments on the living subjects. eckol is a novel exploration for the treatment of major neurodegenerative disorders like Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease. the major reason for the broad spectrum of activity related to eckol is possibly due to its structure. developing eckol as a single pharmaceutical product could be beneficial in the field of medicine.
